# --description-- You can change the `font-family` of text, to make it look different from the default font of your browser. Each browser has some common fonts available to it. Change all the text in your `body`, by adding a `font-family` property with the value `sans-serif`. This is a fairly common font that is very readable. # --hints-- You should set the `font-family` property to `sans-serif`. ```js const hasFontFamily = new __helpers.CSSHelp(document).getCSSRules().some(x => x.style['font-family'] === 'sans-serif'); ``` Your `body` should have a `font-family` of `sans-serif`. ```js const bodyFontFamily = new __helpers.CSSHelp(document).getStyle('body')?.getPropertyValue('font-family'); assert(bodyFontFamily === 'sans-serif'); ``` # --seed-- ## --seed-contents-- ```html Cafe Menu
